comments.body:
Does this link against numpy? It seems like not, in which case you can drop it from `build` requirements (since you're using `--single-version-externally-managed`).

If it is linking against numpy in a way that I don't see, then you'll need to [pin the versions](https://conda-forge.org/docs/meta.html#building-against-numpy).

https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/LICENSE says MIT.

You should also add a `license_file` (legally required for us under the license). I see you're a committer for `onnx`, so you can just add `include LICENSE` to `MANIFEST.in` and it'll be included in the next release. If you'd rather get it in conda-forge before a new release comes out, you can [package it manually](https://conda-forge.org/docs/meta.html#packaging-the-license-manually).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@about:
  home: https://github.com/onnx/onnx/
  license: BSD
  summary: Open Neural Network Exchange library

comments.body: This links against `libprotobuf`, right? If so, you'll need to pin the version both here and in `run` to `protobuf 3.4.*`, since protobuf [isn't backwards-compatible](https://abi-laboratory.pro/tracker/timeline/protobuf/) (see also https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-forge.github.io/pull/411).
